title:
Direct detection of boosted dark matter in two component dark matter
  scenario
abstract:
We investigate the detection of boosted dark matter in a two component dark
matter model with the hidden gauge $U(1)_D$ symmetry. The model introduces
heavy and light fermionic dark matter components, where the heavy dark matter
annihilation in the Galactic center boosts the light dark matter. Directional
direct detection experiments, such as NEWSdm, are suitable for testing the
boosted scenario by focusing on signals from the Galactic center. We found that
the expected event rate could reach up to O(10) events per year per 5 kg of the
detector material.
